definition: head/hair style/the top/end/beginning or end/a stub/remnant/chief/boss/side/aspect/first/leading/classifier for pigs or livestock/CL:個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: The company turned to the head-hunting company for some special positions.
sentences.chinese: 這家公司通過獵頭公司尋找符合特殊崗位的人才。

sentences.english: The rest of our revenues are from headhunting.
sentences.chinese: 我們財政收入的其他部分來自獵頭。

sentences.english: Then one day the husband arrived ahead of schedule for an appointment with a headhunter.
sentences.chinese: 一天，丈夫約好了一家獵頭公司並提前赴約。

sentences.english: Morbid stories of head-hunters, human sacrifice, wild animals.
sentences.chinese: 獵頭，人的犧牲，野獸故事交織呈現。

sentences.english: Search firms say they are finding it harder to lure prospective candidates.
sentences.chinese: 獵頭公司稱，他們發現現在更難吸引潛在的跳槽者了。

sentences.english: One of these new part-time jobs is that of campus headhunter.
sentences.chinese: 校園獵頭便是這些新興兼職之一。

sentences.english: Perhaps I should write a headhunter’s guide to bagging the man of your dreams.
sentences.chinese: 也許我該寫一本教你將夢想老公收入囊中的獵頭指南。

sentences.english: Take a headhunting approach to finding your soul mate.
sentences.chinese: 採取獵頭的策略來尋找白馬王子吧。

sentences.english: Now, I get the whole head-hunting thing.
sentences.chinese: 現在，我知道了整個獵頭的事情。

sentences.english: We are doing our own head-hunting.
sentences.chinese: 我們正在做我們自己的獵頭。

sentences.english: I entered recruiting, and joined Heidrick & Struggles.
sentences.chinese: 我進入了獵頭行業，加入了海德思哲。

sentences.english: Headhunting can assist your company or HR department achieve value added personnel solutions.
sentences.chinese: 獵頭能幫助你公司或者人事部門解決額外人事問題。

sentences.english: You can also even try headhunters.
sentences.chinese: 你還可以試試獵頭公司。

sentences.english: DHC is a professional HR management consulting company( headhunting company).
sentences.chinese: 本公司是一家專業的獵頭公司。

sentences.english: When a head-hunting company persuaded Baoyong to change a job, Baoyong was once hesitant.
sentences.chinese: 獵頭公司來遊說寶詠跳槽的時候，寶詠曾有過猶豫。

definition: to do odd jobs/to do unskilled work
to talk from one's personal experience/to use oneself as an example
to chat and laugh/to crack jokes/to banter
an experienced person/sb who has "been around (the block)"/sb who has personally experienced it
stage/proscenium/foreground in politics etc (sometimes derog.)/front desk/reception desk/(computing) front-end/foreground
to be a real headache/to find sth a real headache/to beat one's brains
to spend effort/to take trouble/May I trouble you to...? (as part of polite request)/Please would you mind...?
lit. chicken speaking with duck/fig. talking without communicating/people not understanding each other
to have one's spirits dampened/to feel disappointed
